| torsade de pointes |

Explanation:

"Torsade de pointes" is a type of abnormal heart rhythm that can be caused by certain medications or medical conditions that affect the electrical activity of the heart. It is characterized by a twisting of the points on the electrocardiogram (ECG) trace, hence the name "torsade de pointes" which means "twisting of the spindle" in French.

"QT intervals" refer to a specific measurement on an ECG that reflects the time it takes for the heart's electrical system to recharge after each heartbeat. Prolonged QT intervals can be a sign of certain heart conditions or can be caused by certain medications.
